From: Sarah Smith <sarah@edison.tech> To: all@edison.tech <all@edison.tech> Subject: New Deal WON-Adervsus Capital Date: May 31, 2019 at 12:34:21 AM GMT+8
Hi All-
I am happy to announce that we have closed a new contract with Adversus Capital. This customer comes to us via our participation in the BattleFin Data Combine for Data Scientists earlier this year. The client is very excited to start using Edison‚Äôs data in their investment strategy and grow our relationship over time.
Thanks to everyone for your help in the sales process!
Sarah

From: Jacob from App Center <jacob.wallraff@app-center.intercom-mail.com> To: jiarong.xu@edison.tech Subject: Enquiry: Custom Crash Log Version/build information on HockeyApp console Date: May 31, 2019 at 5:30:41 AM GMT+8
Sent to Jiarong Xu, support@hockeyapp.net (mailto:support@hockeyapp.net) and liuhui
We haven't pinned down the exact issue with PL Crash Reporter yet. I've created a bug for the issue but since it will take more time it will need to be approved.
MacOS CLI apps aren't officially supported in the App Center SDK right now, but if you would like to see them supported then please open an issue on our public repo: https://github.com/microsoft/appcenter/issues
Is there anything else I can help with?
--
Jacob from App Center
On Wed, May 29, 2019 at 10:05 PM, "Jiarong Xu" <jiarong.xu@edison.tech> wrote: > > Hi Jacob > > > > > > > On the second issue, care to share what is it about PLCrash that is giving the issue? Plain using PLCrash on its own and generating it's own crash report is similar to the one generated by the console. We do not quite understand why would it defer to that generated by AppCenter, since the underlying crash reporting mechanism is still the same PLCrash. > > > > > > > Unfortunately, we do not have access to a High Sierra machine. > > > On Wed, May 29, 2019 at 08:01 PM, "Jacob W" <jacob.wallraff@app-center.intercom-mail.com> wrote: > > > > Took me a while to find the root cause of the second issue. It seems it's an issue with PL Crash Reporter. It's not something that we'll be able to fix right away. > > > > Are you able to verify the first issue on a high sierra machine or do you not have access to one? > > > > > > On Tue, May 28, 2019 at 02:45 PM, "Jacob W" <jacob.wallraff@app-center.intercom-mail.com> wrote: > > > > > > First Issue > > > Jae handed this issue off to me and I was was able to reproduce the "Could not find a loaded image for the current frame pc" issue using the same project he was. My machine is running Mojave (10.14.x), like yours, and Jae's is running High Sierra. It may be that there is an issue with CLI apps on Mojave. It's just a preliminary finding, but I wanted to get back to you as soon as possible. Do you have access to a machine that runs High Sierra to confirm? But when we archive and execute it via the exe file, we can't identify where are the crash logs saved and the crash logs are not uploaded to Hockey at all. We couldn't identify the root cause of it, and couldn't tell if Hockey has magically remove this capability when running it from an archived exe file. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > However, we tested plain PLCrashReporter and was able to get it to generate and save the crash logs in cache even when the project is archived. This was the best solution we could derive thus far. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Perhaps you might be able to shed some light if Hockey is designed to work with command line tool as well. Is there a way to resolve them? > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Screen Shot 2019-05-22 at 10.07.33 AM.png (https://app-center.intercom-mail.com/i/o/122885472/161648f27cff9e003a51eaae/Screen+Shot+2019-05-22+at+10.07.33+AM.png) > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On Tue, May 21, 2019 at 08:00 PM, "Lukas Spie√ü" <lukas.spiess@app-center.intercom-mail.com> wrote: > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hey again! > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Today, we did some preliminary testing with the App Center SDK in a macOS command line tool app and it works properly when appBuild and appVersion are provided as info.plist as part of the app. If the app doesn't have specified a version and a build number, the SDK will consider this as invalid device property and will ignore (with warning message) any of logs. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hope that helps! > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On Mon, May 20, 2019 at 06:48 AM, "Assaf Sapir" <assaf.sapir@app-center.intercom-mail.com> wrote: > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hi, > > > > > > > > > > > > After November 16th, we will continue to forward crashes from HockeyApp to App Center for 1 year. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Assaf > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On Mon, May 20, 2019 at 05:54 AM, "Jiarong Xu" <jiarong.xu@edison.tech> wrote: > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hi Yury > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Can I confirm that by 16 November, we have to migrate our code base from HockeyApp's to App Center's? Meaning to say if we maintain our code base using HockeyApp's SDK, it will not be able to submit crash logs to App Center beyond 16 November? > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Thanks. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On Mon, May 20, 2019 at 02:50 AM, "Jiarong Xu" <jiarong.xu@edison.tech> wrote: > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hi Yury > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > No, we have not considered and tried App Center. Meaning to say, when we run the command line tool straight off Xcode, it compiles and uploads to Hockey successfully. But when we archive and execute it via the exe file, we can't identify where are the crash logs saved and the crash logs are not uploaded to Hockey at all. We couldn't identify the root cause of it, and couldn't tell if Hockey has magically remove this capability when running it from an archived exe file. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > However, we tested plain PLCrashReporter and was able to get it to generate and save the crash logs in cache even when the project is archived. Therefore, we resorted to the idea of piecing PLCrashReporter to generate the report, and then use Hockey API to upload to Hockey console. This was the best solution we could derive thus far. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Perhaps you might be able to shed some light if Hockey is designed to work with command line tool as well. From: Jessica Cooper <jessica@edison.tech> To: Kesava Neeli <neeli@edison.tech>, jeff <jeff@edison.tech>, Shuhao Zhang <shuhao@edison.tech> Cc: All <all@edison.tech> Subject: Today's Price Alert Debut on Edison Mail Date: June 5, 2019 at 8:17:33 AM GMT+8
Hi team,
Congratulations and enormous gratitude to Neeli, Jeff, Shuhao and their respective teams for all of the hard work and dedication they put into developing Price Alert, the newest feature that was released today on Edison Mail at the App Store!
Price Alert is our new feature that notifies you when the price of your recent purchase drops so you can request a refund for the difference from the store right from your mailbox.
The functionality took over a year to develop and is a very important addition to our app at this time in our company.
Learn more about the feature from our blog post about the release here: https://medium.com/changing-communications/new-price-alerts-in-your-mailbox-help-you-shop-the-best-deal-d3edc718cb0c
Great work and THANK YOU platform, design and client teams for bringing this awesome new feature to life!!
Best, Jessica
jessica@edison.tech

Muzli is already a goldmine of inspiring, beautiful, and fresh content, stunningly delivered every time you open a new Chrome tab. Now Muzli Search lets you find the eureka moments you‚Äôre looking for, so you can take your creativity even further.

From: Shuhao Zhang <shuhao@edison.tech> To: all <all@edison.tech> Subject: Mac app alpha2 Date: June 8, 2019 at 6:49:38 AM GMT+8
Many improvements have been made since the first version - cleaner UI, faster to load messages, document preview and so much more details got taken care of.
Chat is also included in this version. Try it out and tell us what you think. It's using staging environment, so chat messages will be not be sync'ed to mobile app.
If you installed alpha 1 before, run this command in Terminal to clear cached data first:
rm -rf ~/Library/Application\ Support/EdisonMail
Download alpha 2 here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=11vaL1o37PSe4SAYExeV9hfBktT_gcfrB
Share your feedback on slack #mac-app-feedback channel!
Thanks, Shuhao

Hi Jia,
The New Design Frontier (https://get.invisionapp.com/e2t/c/*Vr79yc7d0s8lW8gv5gX6Wg0KK0/*W14gNqw8gbDrCW8-zndz4R5DJh0/5/f18dQhb0S4JY2dYTs8TvNKV1gnzTxW33V0gp1fChpqN3dRppVRfG-kW5rk7g92My9SNW2fRc_b4m9M_7W456jtD47RyxHW4dww8x9hb1fzW6zPtWx4SghnMW18Dwp9132-pNW98_y217x-jKxN6d6s45Ty0hGW4v0Xbt71vMLVN5bYR0YL1HjSW2T1vR67cRq52W8X_-N722yNH0W1TBBq_16c-X9W4d4hMn2Hf86QN6HXCW8Y3RXLW308yHS5XWKqvW5Qfvfy1qMS4RW58Kyl83_T0F0W2mqJgH3NCFLTW4Sy4hY56QKTZW4RGLPw86CT9WW1V6G7y2YqWX8W2kVg7314rC5BW7XG_Gs6y4j1JW78BfpB5GG4q-W5w8D218KLmP3W2-1hf769Pz46W5dX1tS3HK6lFW3lww3t3X4wj1W5pJfYl1hJs30W3d_10h7SljMgW7cG51Y8thhKCW9lvFCx4VvfYfW1XHBkk2DJngyW8S20q4241_Z6W4-zf_w5qnYGXW2cwkZD9gFVsyW98fkSp60rzzPW4xFWMQ6gNr4SW81FSSk41NmL4N8lnXZq5689Kf553dq-03) revealed preliminary findings from a massive, worldwide research project ‚Äì diving into design practice and business benefits at over 2,200 companies, with over 10,000 data points.

This webinar outlines the result of that work (https://get.invisionapp.com/e2t/c/*Vr79yc7d0s8lW8gv5gX6Wg0KK0/*VM604f3ZzZhFW4qbyVm5pv5Zr0/5/f18dQhb0SbTY8Y9ZwPW70BpRg4T_wDdW7gbDGW7fZFJdMscTTsXD6prW7cmS1s8pCQ6vW5CR6n97cVKJwW50lYRv7nwMJHW8p7zZL4rQf3rW98PFGh1njZLGW1xc3bN8xH3nDW1nrCGB51LTg5W2mnfcb2-PR65W49_Bn_2p2WPTW2Ywn8Y2GvSwtW6Bt4HJ1_QrvgN1Y_Y5Jg8nD_W5F_2Jd3YblgxW7z2NMJ7vRb97W22j1F08f6lmlW2z_scn6x2RKSW5-lMJc5sSp8qW3JVM_n3vdw1dW510T2R3SNZpVW5kybr-5xFw4DW46ryn04VSR7MW5PT53Q2-w9X9W5rhGZM6VQVTXW2TVlzy6vz8jQW30SYXP643ypbW62sjft4VllcVW6vxnRq625TNbW4L3p5-3K3ptzW5P1cNH82G-SFW2lZHjC1NFfl4W8P4m4R5152PvVS9K5r8Cl0GMV1K6Ys5S0w_MW5G36xM19rc8kW7qr3Xv7Vj_2hW4DZRL71tj0nzW7xBcd293fLt1W6BVH5J6Sw1zXW2pglVT6vc-Z6W6V0LFv3S9Pl40).

From: Jacob from App Center <jacob.wallraff@app-center.intercom-mail.com> To: jiarong.xu@edison.tech Subject: Enquiry: Custom Crash Log Version/build information on HockeyApp console Date: May 29, 2019 at 2:45:07 AM GMT+8
Sent to Jiarong Xu, support@hockeyapp.net (mailto:support@hockeyapp.net) and hui-edison.tech
First Issue Jae handed this issue off to me and I was was able to reproduce the "Could not find a loaded image for the current frame pc" issue using the same project he was. My machine is running Mojave (10.14.x), like yours, and Jae's is running High Sierra. It may be that there is an issue with CLI apps on Mojave. It's just a preliminary finding, but I wanted to get back to you as soon as possible. Do you have access to a machine that runs High Sierra to confirm? Also, which architecture(s) are you building your app for?
Second Issue I'm just starting investigation on this now, I'll get back to you as soon as I have more info.

But we will now. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > We will contact you should we encounter any problems, thanks. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On Fri, May 17, 2019 at 09:10 AM, "Yury N" <yury.n@app-center.intercom-mail.com> wrote: > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hi, short question - did you consider or try out AppCenter macOS SDK (https://github.com/microsoft/AppCenter-SDK-Apple) to track crashes? > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Thanks, Yury. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On Thu, May 16, 2019 at 02:10 AM, "Jiarong Xu" <jiarong.xu@edison.tech> wrote: > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hi Stefan > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Yes, we understand that there is an SDK for macOS that does that. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > We are building a command line tool, not macOS app, and we have tested the macOS SDK but was not able to get it to work when the project is archived. Meaning to say, when we run the command line tool straight off Xcode, it compiles and uploads to Hockey successfully. But when we archive and execute it via the exe file, we can't identify where are the crash logs saved and the crash logs are not uploaded to Hockey at all. We couldn't identify the root cause of it, and couldn't tell if Hockey has magically remove this capability when running it from an archived exe file. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > However, we tested plain PLCrashReporter and was able to get it to generate and save the crash logs in cache even when the project is archived. Therefore, we resorted to the idea of piecing PLCrashReporter to generate the report, and then use Hockey API to upload to Hockey console. This was the best solution we could derive thus far. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Perhaps you might be able to shed some light if Hockey is designed to work with command line tool as well. Resources on integration of Hockey with command line tools are quite limited on SO and the internet. Thanks. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > On Wed, May 15, 2019 at 07:52 AM, "Stefan H." <stefan@app-center.intercom-mail.com> wrote: > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Hi Jiaron, > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > first of all I want to ask again why exactly you are implementing a custom crash solution for macOS since there is a fully available HockeyApp SDK for macOS. Which would just work and do all the right things. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > You wrote on your SO question "I followed the crash report format as on their website (https://support.hockeyapp.net/kb/api/api-crashes) and verified that the Version on the crash report is:". Maybe I'm missing something but none of the 4 crashes in the "1.3(3)" group is looking like that format we specify on our custom API page. Your initially tests where with Java Crashes and they followed the specified format. Now you are sending in Apple Logs. > > > > > > > > > > > > > This is not going to work. If you want to send in crashes in Apple format you have to either use our SDK, manually upload them through the UI or use the API the macOS SDK is using but that API is not documented at all. You can try to copy our mac SDK in that regard but please let me plainly point out that we will not provide any support for that. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > From: PlanGrid <support@plangrid.com> To: jiarong.xu@edison.tech Subject: PlanGrid Launches Project Hub to bring your closer to the field Date: June 20, 2019 at 9:58:50 PM GMT+8
Hi Jr,
As your project data grows in PlanGrid, it can be a challenge to navigate, focus and keep track of the items that need your attention. Project Hub (http://em.plangrid.com/ZS0gc0oLp0000605P20jVJF) is your new home screen on Web, where you can see what‚Äôs happening on your project in one place.
With Project Hub, see your team's activity in real time, and quickly identify who needs to sync to the most current set. Stay focused with a personalized view of work assigned to you as well as any flagged items that are overdue or unassigned. Plan better with a quick view of your project timeline, local weather, and more.
Start using Project Hub (http://em.plangrid.com/ZS0gc0oLp0000605P20jVJF), now automatically available for all projects on PlanGrid.
LEARN MORE (http://em.plangrid.com/ZS0gc0oLp0000605P20jVJF)

Crafting effective emails is easier than you think ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå
Supercharge your email writing!
Whether you‚Äôre sending lots of emails at work, or just looking for your dream company, it‚Äôs important to master business email writing! We‚Äôve prepared some tips on how to craft a professional email and a follow up message after the all-important job interview.
While you‚Äôre honing your writing skills, we keep improving Spark based on your feedback üòâ Read on to learn how our support team shares your ideas with our developers.
How to write a professional email
An effective email has a clear goal and call to action, values a recipient‚Äôs time, and is easy to read. Learn how to compose such a message and what to check before hitting ‚ÄúSend.‚Äù
Read more (https://readdle.cmail20.com/t/d-l-piikuht-jyhkkyedk-y/)
How to follow up by email after a job interview
In a follow up email, you‚Äôll need to show your interest and enthusiasm about the company without being pushy and annoying. We‚Äôve asked our recruiter how to do it right.
Learn more (https://readdle.cmail20.com/t/d-l-piikuht-jyhkkyedk-t/)
Sharing user feedback with developers: How we do it in Spark
Our support team receives tons of feedback from users üíå. Learn how your wishes come true after they get to our Inbox.
Find out (https://readdle.cmail20.com/t/d-l-piikuht-jyhkkyedk-d/)
With love, Spark Team üíô

From: Jessica Cooper <jessica@edison.tech> To: All <all@edison.tech> Subject: Edison Trends Summer Survey & Prize Raffle - Submit Your Ideas to Win Date: June 22, 2019 at 7:40:38 AM GMT+8
Hi team,
The marketing team would like to conduct a brief summer survey to collect ideas you might have about how to offer Edison Trends insights that would appeal to consumers. This is not something we have on our roadmap but we are collecting ideas. For example, if you were an avid rideshare user, would it appeal to you to know how much you tip your rideshare drivers on average compared to the average in your zip code/city/state/country? Or understand how much you spend at Amazon weekly vs the rest of your city?
There are no bad ideas and we appreciate you sending any suggestions you might have by next Friday, June 28th, at the following link: https://forms.gle/TMY5ySkpYkJQWVkaA
The team will then hold a raffle and award the winner a $25 gift card for a coffee shop of their choice!
Thanks! The Marketing team
Jessica Cooper
Marketing & PR Manager
Edison Software

From: PlanGrid Newsletter <apac@plangrid.com> To: jiarong.xu@edison.tech Subject: New from PlanGrid: Boost Project Visibility and Extend Workflows to the Field Date: June 26, 2019 at 7:30:22 AM GMT+8
June 2019 Newsletter
PRODUCT WEBINAR
Close the loop to resolve RFIs faster
PlanGrid Advanced RFIs makes it effortless to create RFIs as soon as issues are found on the jobsite, collaborate with stakeholders, and move RFIs from one stage to the next. By automating this process, Advanced RFIs means that nothing slips through the cracks. Now it‚Äôs more intuitive than ever for your team to create, review, and distribute RFIs. Join the webinar (http://em.plangrid.com/uQ00005Sgj0p0U02Nc6JVo0) on July 2nd to see this new feature in action.
REGISTER TODAY (http://em.plangrid.com/uQ00005Sgj0p0U02Nc6JVo0)
PRODUCT NEWS
Track field activity with Project Hub
See everything that‚Äôs happening on your project without missing a beat ‚Äî from a steady feed of recent activity, a real-time view of who‚Äôs on the most current set to a personalized list of your assigned work. Get a quick visual of your timeline, local weather and items that are overdue or unassigned. Stay focused, plan better and move faster with Project Hub (http://em.plangrid.com/rg0S0V2N0SWj50Joc0060p0). The new homescreen is now available for all projects on PlanGrid.
WATCH MORE (http://em.plangrid.com/rg0S0V2N0SWj50Joc0060p0)
PRODUCT NEWS
Get changes and costs approved in no time
Every change event that has a cost impact requires supporting documentation to substantiate the cost, but keeping track of all of this information is time-consuming and tedious. Currently in closed beta, PlanGrid‚Äôs Change Tracker (http://em.plangrid.com/m0000X20g06pojc5SNT0JV0) is your answer to the challenges you face when managing change events for any project. Simply initiate change events, automatically compile quotes and just as easily, authorize work to begin.
JOIN THE BETA (http://em.plangrid.com/m0000X20g06pojc5SNT0JV0)
PRODUCT NEWS
Overlay sheets on the web to spot differences
One of PlanGrid‚Äôs most popular features is now available for web. With Sheet Compare (http://em.plangrid.com/dp0jcoU0N60V500SgY020J0) on web, keep up with changes on the jobsite by overlaying any two sheets to see the differences. You can even manually drag the sheet into a more precise alignment. Identify issues before they occur with more accurate clash detection and constructability reviews.
READ MORE (http://em.plangrid.com/dp0jcoU0N60V500SgY020J0)
PRODUCT NEWS
Save time approving Submittals
Recently PlanGrid launched PDF Markups for Submittals (http://em.plangrid.com/JS2jJ60VoV00ZN50pc000g0) to enable team collaboration on submittal documents directly within PlanGrid. Now we‚Äôve enhanced this offering by adding Bookmarks to enable you to more quickly navigate through the document, and Smart Stamps to reduce the number of steps it takes to sign off on a submittal.
READ MORE (http://em.plangrid.com/JS2jJ60VoV00ZN50pc000g0)
PRODUCT NEWS
Bulk user actions & more export options in the Admin Console
Manage users and projects more easily with new power features. You can now perform any user action for multiple users at once (such as changing/upgrading licenses, removing users, editing notes, resetting passwords, expiring sessions, and enabling/disabling SSO). Exporting the users and projects pages to CSV now includes more fields, such as a list of all projects for each user and project statuses/codes.
READ MORE (http://em.plangrid.com/kJ00j0000Nc02Sp65o0Wg0V)
CUSTOMER NEWS
Become a PlanGrid Champion today!
We‚Äôre very excited to invite you to join the PlanGrid Champion Program! The program recognizes customers who are trailblazers and change agents, like you, by spotlighting their success across their organization and the industry. Whether you‚Äôre PlanGrid‚Äôs #1 fan or have had a few positive experiences you‚Äôre willing to share with a broader community, you're a perfect fit for our Champion Program. Sign up here (http://em.plangrid.com/p0g00J0o1V060X0Spj0c5N2) to learn more and connect with our Customer Marketing Maven, Alyssa Jaber.
LEARN MORE (http://em.plangrid.com/p0g00J0o1V060X0Spj0c5N2)

Insights to transform your talent acquisition strategy
Hi Jia,
Design-driven businesses have been proven to significantly outperform competitors, increasing the demand for skilled product designers.
In fact, 81% of product designers are contacted by recruiters on at least a monthly basis, making the competition for top talent more challenging, even for top brands.
To better understand how companies can recruit the best talent, InVision surveyed over 1,600 product designers and employers around the world. The resulting 2019 Product Design Hiring Report (https://get.invisionapp.com/e2t/c/*N7KFvw646rpTW8YW85X4KpDt50/*W72Qn4D1cr3LZW6DFK9N8R_hsn0/5/f18dQhb0Sjv78YHs-8W88T8pQ2qwv31VK0krS2MTTkhMf5gNKXD6prW39Dr-N8pCDLQW4rxpl_5DQqVhV9X0H996Ls6fW5Cqzfm8y8RJwVcPtNw90G7thN8S3yR5bY02SW4s7W-01wyS5tW1bw02K2GrwKrW6Bt4HJ1_QrvgN1Y_Y5Jg8nD_W5F_2Jd3YblgxW7z2NMJ7vRb97W22fV2t45Jz18W5-2sjB7ZzDyKW7GLjPj2LG-jcW2jHtRm7h0F1nW7ZHvXP1mfWq0W1RnrvQ1Db5jPW5_fDcK68TMVMW1frnHz5T1QSmW1G6MzM1nzN19W1D57mX85CLBDW1Rpwh31Rg-MhW1kj7Mk1HnS5kW7JPVlw1bRJytW6jLgZp1T_PcWW6tsxc542kgb0N8W6BcjrX3l1W6VzGBK3C2S33W2z3xDw4sVGVjW2n9QsZ8tBr0WW1pNFLK2GD9PDW48GGTj42MphhN5frYl7pD7LjW5LblMb9bxTS2W1n-kdW4mG3SdM4ZDML2LMBkV18whD8Y8ry6103)‚Äîthe first report of its kind‚Äîis packed with insights that will help you transform your talent acquisition strategy at each stage of the hiring process‚Äî from attraction to interviewing to retention. From: Sarah Nagy <sarah.nagy@edison.tech> To: Undisclosed recipient Subject: Welcome Fernando Hipolito Date: July 2, 2019 at 5:19:49 AM GMT+8
Hello Everyone,
Please welcome Fernando Hipolito to our NY Data Science team. Many of you know Fernando from his wonderful job interning for us last summer. The KPI Database that he generated has returned massive dividends since he completed it almost a year ago, as it has helped to fuel our KPI newsletter as well as the bias correction work done by the Research team, and has helped us better understand our public equity coverage. He has fortuitously agreed to join us full-time starting today, as a Data Analyst specializing in financial applications of our data.
Fernando is a fresh graduate from Princeton, with a degree in Economics. He is an important asset to our New York office, and will help us work with clients and prospects to answer finance-specific questions they have about our data. He will also help us build data products as we expand our financial vertical business beyond raw data.
Welcome, Fernando!
Sarah Nagy Senior Data Scientist Edison
sarah.nagy@edison.tech

We couldn't identify the root cause of it, and couldn't tell if Hockey has magically remove this capability when running it from an archived exe file. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > However, we tested plain PLCrashReporter and was able to get it to generate and save the crash logs in cache even when the project is archived. Therefore, we resorted to the idea of piecing PLCrashReporter to generate the report, and then use Hockey API to upload to Hockey console. This was the best solution we could derive thus far. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Perhaps you might be able to shed some light if Hockey is designed to work with command line tool as well. From: Richard Alicea <richard@edison.tech> To: all <all@edison.tech> Subject: NEW DEAL WON - Procter & Gamble Date: July 3, 2019 at 5:35:44 AM GMT+8
Hi Team,
I am pleased to announce that we have closed a new deal with P&G the #2 global CPG company, it was recently unseated by Nestle who took the #1 spot. P&G has signed a deal that will consist of 6 strategic data projects where they will be working with Edison as a Customer Service Bureau. P&G has identified Edison as the right eCommerce partner to answer the key questions they have about online Personal Grooming buyers.
We earned this new deal with the success the "The Best Men Can Be" data project we worked on with them earlier this year. P&G continued to ask questions about what else was possible with our data. I would like to extend my sincere gratitude to our stellar Data Science team who worked closely with the Head of P&G's Analytic & Insights on this project. Edison delivered the right data for the questions they needed answered about their men's shaving strategy.
A Big Shout Out to Joachim and Jeff for all the hard work on building the Trends shaving views that proved to P&G the strength of our data. A big Thank You to Noble and Alex who spent hours on calls with P&G's Analytic & Insights Manager about the type of insights that would be available for their strategic initiatives.
P&G is already talking about future projects that would expand to other categories and the possibility of replacing their current eCommerce data provider with Edison.
Thanks again to everyone at Edison, because it was a big collaboration that made a success like this happen!
Richard Alicea Director, Strategic Analytic Solutions
richard@edison.tech Mobile: 954-655-0961
richard@edison.tech
NEW DEAL WON - Procter & Gamble
